project.name: qa
project.description: The Quality Assurance Project provides an umbrella project for keeping Gentoo's portage tree in a consistent state across all the architectures. This means that syntax, dependencies (both compile-time and run-time), file sizes, changelog and metadata entries are all kept up to date and as accurate as possible.

extraproject.name: RepoSuperMan
extraproject.p: Repoman is a tool that is used by Gentoo developers to perform pre-commit quality checks. It is available in the gentoolkit-dev package currently. Sven has taken the code and updated it to perform better and more through checks on a tree wide basis.

body.p: All current and future Gentoo developers should endeavour to be a part of the QA project in some fashion. This includes helping to come up with a QA policy, as well as doing your part to ensure that your packages meet a certain set of QA standards. Additionally, we hope that all Gentoo developers will be co-operative in finding and fixing QA issues. Future and prospective developers can contact our recruiters.
